'''Alpha v1.1.0''', also known as '''Seecret Friday 9''', is a version of [[Java Edition Alpha]] released with server versions [[Alpha server 0.2.0|0.2.0]] and [[Alpha server 0.2.0 01|0.2.0_01]] on September 10, 2010,<ref>[[wordofnotch:1098183801|"Seecret Friday 9! OooooOOOoo! And Minecraft Alpha 1.1.0! And Minecraft Server 0.2.0!"]] – [[The Word of Notch]], September 10, 2010</ref> at 18:40 UTC.<ref>[[Java Edition Alpha server 0.2.0|The server version]] was compiled 7 minutes before the archived version (18:47 UTC), plus people on IRC logs reported about update before that time<br>
{{Cite IRC logs|Adura|tz=standard|file=2010-09-10_#minecraft.log|"14:46:22 <Risugami> uhh hey. my client is updating"..."14:46:36 <JasonPK> mine too#"..."14:47:21 <Risugami> 1.1.0"}}</ref> This version notably added a shared client-server [[inventory]]. It is the ninth and last [[Seecret Friday]] update.

Alpha v1.1.0 was reuploaded later on the day of release.{{more info}}

Alpha v1.1.0 was reuploaded on September 13, 2010,{{verify|edition=java}} to fix a bug where the player could force the camera's movement inside walls.

The version found in the launcher is the first reupload version, but is recompiled differently and has a different checksum.

== Additions ==
{{Additions table|Compass}}

=== Items ===
'''[[File:Compass JE1.gif|32px]] [[Compass]]'''
* Always points towards the world spawn point.
* Crafted with [[iron ingot]] and [[redstone dust]].
{{Crafting table
|A2=Iron Ingot
|B1=Iron Ingot
|B2=Redstone Dust
|B3=Iron Ingot
|C2=Iron Ingot
|Output=Compass}}

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Monster Spawner JE1.png|32px]] [[Monster Spawner]]'''
* No longer render the model of the [[mob]] inside of them.

=== World generation ===
'''Other'''
* [[Clay]] is more common when a world is generated.

=== Gameplay ===
'''[[Multiplayer]]'''
* Experimental switch to turn on monsters in [[multiplayer]].
* The [[inventory]] is now saved on multiplayer servers.
* Servers now save player locations upon leaving the server.

== Fixes ==
'''2 bugs fixed'''
* Chests, signs, and furnaces now work in multiplayer.
* Fixed a bug where the player could force the camera's movement inside walls.<ref group=note>This change occurred in the second reupload of this version.</ref></onlyinclude>
